meanings.definition: The amount of space occupied by a three-dimensional object, measured in cubic units.
meanings.sent1: The cubages of the box were small, so it couldn't hold many toys.
meanings.sent2: The architect calculated the cubages of the rooms to ensure they were spacious enough.
meanings.sent3: The cubages of the refrigerator were so tiny that it could barely fit a single watermelon.
meanings.sent4: The cubages of the storage unit expanded magically to accommodate all the items.
meanings.sent5: I could visualize the cubages of the swimming pool by imagining it filled with colorful balls.

meanings.definition: The act or process of calculating the volume or capacity of something.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed the cubages of different shapes and sizes during her math class.
meanings.sent2: The cubages of the containers were crucial for determining the shipping costs.
meanings.sent3: The cubages of the cake ingredients made her feel like a scientist in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like a computer when it came to the cubages of complex equations.
meanings.sent5: The cubages of the puzzle pieces helped her solve the mystery in record time.

meanings.definition: The total volume or capacity of a container or enclosed space.
meanings.sent1: The cubages of the jars were written on labels for easy reference.
meanings.sent2: The moving company needed to know the cubages of each truck to plan efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The cubages of the suitcase seemed to shrink as she tried to fit in more clothes.
meanings.sent4: The cubages of the warehouse were so vast that it felt like a maze of boxes.
meanings.sent5: The cubages of the treasure chest hinted at the riches hidden inside.
